text: Cleide Amaral (born 17 July 1967 in Campo Limpo PaulistaSports-Reference profile) is a retired Brazilian athlete who specialised in the sprinting events. She represented her country at the 1996 Summer Olympics, as well as 1993, 1995 and 1997 World Championships. In addition, she won multiple medals on regional level. Her personal best in the 100 metres is 11.38, set in 1995. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1987 |rowspan=2|Pan American Games |rowspan=2|Indianapolis, United
